channel.title: Automatically Install?
channel.description:
I want to create an application to automatically install some applications
* AVG 9.0 * Anti-Malwarebytes * SpywareBlaster * Auslogics DiskDefrag * CCleaner * Open Office
I want it to be an OFFLINE installation, Ive had a quick look around the internet and found a program called ninite however this only offers a online installation, which I do not want because of bandwidth usage. I tried to setup a cache server however ninite uses lots of different mirrors for its installation files so it skips the cache server alot of times.
If you could possibly link me to some info on auto-installing some of these programs?

item.title: Automatically Install?
item.dc:creator: @eczema3 eczema3
item.description:
@eczema3 wrote:

Avast removes viruses, AVG just shrugs and continues pretending to search.

Read full topic

AVG? If you’re going to use antivirus for free, get Avast.
[/quote]Umm, no? AVG is good.[/quote]

AVG is way better, Avast sucks.

Read full topic

item.title: Automatically Install?
item.dc:creator: @Ollie Ollie
item.description:
@Ollie wrote:

Ninite Pro requires you to pay per month, which I cannot justify when there are free alternate options.

The problem is im not always installing new machines, sometimes a customer will have a damaged machine and i will just need to remove a virus, and just need the anti-virus & anti-malware software installing.

I will look into InstallShield switches as I have read about them before but never put them into practice.

Read full topic

item.title: Automatically Install?
item.dc:creator: @chri5 chri5
item.description:
@chri5 wrote:

I know there are some switches you can do on InstallShield and similar, but I personally would slipstream these into the OS using nLite, vLite or rt7lite.

You could even include updates and the CD Key for a truly headless install.

EDIT: Ninite pro allows offline installation.

Read full topic
